comments.author: lisacohen
comments.content: This sounds great. I'll have to give this a try. We've been celebrating Shabbat too pretty regularly this past year and I've been baking challahs on Friday (the recipe I use makes two loaves) but I almost always forget to make our Friday night dinner go well with the challah. You would think I'd be better about this because it *is* a thing I do weekly!...but somehow I'm not... maybe it's because we all relish the French toast we have every Saturday morning (and I freeze all the French toast leftovers and my 7 and 4 year old eat it for breakfast during the week before school).... so all is not wasted!

When you talk about adding roasted pears, etc.  would you do that after it is baked, or would you top the bread pudding before putting it in the oven?

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content:
Christi - Good question. I would roast them in a skillet or baking dish
first, trying to evaporate off a lot of the water, then mix them in with the
custard before baking.
